ShortSummary: An interface that lets HikariCP obtain username/password dynamically via a Credentials object.
Summary: HikariCredentialsProvider defines a single method, getCredentials(), to supply runtime-resolved credentials to HikariCP instead of hardcoding them. Implementations can fetch or generate credentials from external sources (e.g., secret managers) and return a com.zaxxer.hikari.util.Credentials containing username and password. Invocation timing/refresh behavior is not specified here and depends on the pool integration.
MostImportantThings: It is an interface meant for dynamic credential provisioning at runtime.
Useful for secret rotation or external secret stores.
Thread-safety and refresh cadence are not defined in this interface (likely determined by HikariCP usage).
RelatedFunctionality: HikariConfig/HikariDataSource integration points that consume credentials (exact hooks depend on version/config)
External secret providers (e.g., Vault, AWS Secrets Manager, GCP Secret Manager) for implementing the provider
